Dear patient

Central Complaints Team

Barts Health NHS Trust

signature: Natasha Andrews, Governance Manager, West Cornwall Hospital and St Michaels Hospital, Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust
body:
Dear Santa Claus  
Thank you for taking the time for sharing your story with us. My name is Natasha Andrews and I am the Governance Manager for West Cornwall Hospital.  
I am so sorry to hear that your recent attendance with your son to the Urgent Treatment Centre at West Cornwall Hospital was not to the standard we expect as a Trust. We would like the opportunity to discuss the points that you have raised so that we can give feedback to the team and learn from your experience.  
If you would like to contact me directly my telephone number is 07818 430303 and I will be happy to discuss further or alternatively if you would like to raise your concerns formally, you can do this by contacting our Patient and Family Experience Team (Complaints) using the details below. They will ensure that your experience is investigated fully:  
Email: rcht.patientexperience@nhs.net  
Tel: 01872 252793  
In the meantime I will ensure that I share your story with the team so that they can reflect on your experience. Once again thank you for taking the time to share your story with us.  
Kind regards  
Natasha Andrews

signature: Suzie Sellberg, Clinical Practice Educator/Lead Nurse, Inclusion Sexual Health, Inclusion
body:
Hi elephanttx73  
Thank you for your valuable feedback. Please call the clinic if you have any concerns and would like to speak to us about your tests. Sometimes patients need to repeat tests due to 'window periods' (this is the time it takes from when you have been exposed to an infection to when it is likely to be detected on tests). Also, there are some rarer infections that are not tested for routinely when patients first attend clinic but may be considered if initial tests are clear and symptoms fail to settle. Sometimes infections are not the cause of the symptoms so tests are done and are accurately reported as negative, and the patient needs to be seen elsewhere to get the problem sorted e.g. gynaecology, urology, or dermatology specialists. Please do call us if you are worried and would like to discuss this further. The clinic number is 0808 178 0955. Please select the option for Health Advisers.
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body:
Dear Sir/Madam,  
Thank you for taking the time to express your concern about the inadequate care you have received. I am sorry to hear that this has been your experience of the team. This is not the level of care we aim to provide to the users of our service and their loved ones.  
I'd like to apologise for any distress this matter may have caused you. We take complaints and comments seriously and will continue to reach out to people with compassion, kindness, dignity and respect.  
Please can I ask you to make contact so we can discuss which team you are referring to and discuss the situation further. Please contact pals directly on 0800 064 3330 or email pals@westlondon.nhs.uk.  
Please accept my sincere apologies. I look forward to hearing from you.  
Millicent  
Patient Experience Officer

body:
I had an account of my partner's difficulties published on this site on 2nd January. This concerned a stroke patient being treated in the John Radcliffe but whose GP is resident in Warwickshire and therefore rehab needs to be provided by Warwickshire. We are now day 28 – no stroke rehab.  
It was suggested to me that I contact the PALs team to seek some help and raise a complaint.  
I spoke to the one in the John Radcliffe first. Unfortunately, they would be unable to help because although we live in an Oxfordshire post code it is Warwickshire that is responsible for medical services.  
So off I went to the University Hospital Coventry PALs office and their response was how they would very much like to help if they could but because your partner is not a patient in Warwickshire then we can’t!  
So we remain in limbo and there is little sign that this impasse will ever end. In the meantime as you can imagine my partner's mental health is deteriorating and who knows what damage is being done to her long term physical well being.

signature: Louise Currie, Professional Nursing Development Facilitator/Nurse Manager Support, OPPC, SHSCT

body:
Hi
Thank you so much for taking the time to leave this positive review. I will be sure to pass on your kind words to the rest of the team. 
Kind regards
Rebecca
Assistant Practice Manager

Dear Sam
Thank you for taking time to contact us with feedback. We are pleased that you are happy with the care provided at Whipps Cross Hospital. We value your feedback as its confirmation to staff and the organization of the excellent care provided at Barts Health. We would like to share your kind words with the team that took care of you and would like to request that you email your details to wxpals.bartshealth@nhs.net
We look forward to hearing from you
Kind regards
Central Complaints Team

Thank you for taking the time to post your review here on the NHS website. We welcome any and all comments from our patients and would therefore value the opportunity to discuss this with you directly; by sharing your experience with us, we can look to improve our service for all our patients. If this is something you would like to do, please contact your practice directly and ask to speak with the Duty Manager, telling them this is in response to a comment posted to the NHS website.

Dear Susan,

I was really pleased to read your comments around the service you received at our vaccination clinic.

The team worked really hard to ensure the clinics ran as smoothly as possible so it is great to receive such positive feedback.

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.

Kind Regards

Mark Little
Practice Manager

We look forward to hearing from you

body:
Dear patient,

Thank you for taking the time leave your feedback on this website.

I am sorry to hear that your experience with the practice has been a negative one. If you would like to discuss this further please contact the practice and provide your details.

Best wishes
The Sides Medical Centre

Dear Susan Wilkinson 
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback relating to your recent visit to our Breast Clinic and your comments regarding the staff you came into contact with.
Your feedback has been recorded and it will be shared with the Breast Clinic staff.
Take Care 
Sylvia 
Patient Experience Manager

What a lovely review and a lovely start to the new year.  Thanks so much to share this positive feedback, that's very much appreciated.
Really glad to hear that the online system is working well, we have recently made some changes to streamline it a little, so hopefully this makes the process a little quicker each day.
Thanks again for taking the time to share your positive comments, all the staff really appreciate that.

Best wishes

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are delighted that you have had a positive experience and we will pass on these comments to the relevant staff.

Kind regards,
Barnsley Hospital

Thank you for taking the time to post your review here on the NHS website. We welcome any and all comments from our patients and would therefore value the opportunity to discuss this with you directly; by sharing your experience with us, we can look to improve our service for all our patients. If this is something you would like to do, please contact your practice directly and ask to speak with the Duty Manager, telling them this is in response to a comment posted to the NHS website

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are delighted that you have had a positive experience and we will pass on these comments to the relevant staff.

Kind regards,
Barnsley Hospital

Dear Andy

Thank you for taking the time to post your comments regarding your recent visit to our hospital.

Coming into hospital can be daunting time for anyone and I can fully appreciate what an anxious time it must have been for you.  Therefore, it is lovely to read how staff provided you with the support you needed and in particular one of our Anaesthetist's.  

I will share your kind words with the team as I know how much they will appreciate your feedback.

Thank you again and I hope you are recovering well.

Kind regards
Clare Blackburn
(Head of Patient Experience)

Thank you for taking the time to post your comments regarding your recent experience.

I am sorry to read of your experience and how you have described staff being unsympathetic and dismissive.  The Trust has clear values and behaviours that all staff should adhere to and I am sorry that this was not your experience.

I will share your feedback with the team so that they fully understand what a negative impact this has had on you.

Thank you again and I hope you are recovering well.

Kind regards
Clare Blackburn
(Head of Patient Experience)
Thank you for leaving a review. We are pleased that you had a good experience and felt at ease. Best wishes, Newmedica patient care team

Dear Steph

Thank you for taking the time to post your comments regarding your mum's recent visit to our hospital.

I cannot begin to imagine what a worrying time this must have been for you and your family.  It is so lovely to read how staff were "amazing" and very supportive.  All of our staff aim to provide a high standard of care and treatment and it is clear this has been your experience.

I will share your kind words with the team and thank you again for your comments.

I hope your mum is recovering well.

Kind regards
Clare Blackburn
(Head of Patient Experience)

Dear Patient
Many thanks for your feedback. We are sorry that your recent experience has not been a positive one. Please can you contact the surgery on 01204 578128 with your name and contact details to allow us to investigate further.

Dear Patient
Thank you for your further feedback on the service you were provided  I will ensure this is shared with the full primary care team, KIndest regards Sharon Snape Practice Manager

Dear Patient
Thank you for your feedback on your experience with Lambgates Health Centre, we are so pleased to hear your positive feedback particularly at this very busy and demanding period within the NHS, I will ensure this is shared with all the primary care team.  Kindest Regards Mrs Sharon Snape Practice Manager.
We appreciate feedback and look to continuously improve our service to our patients to aim for excellence.

body: I'm sorry that your recent experience differed from when you attended in July, but without knowing the full details we cannot respond any further. If you would like us to look into this further, please contact our Patient Advice and Liaison Service (PALS) on tel: 01227 783145 or email: ekh-tr.pals@nhs.net. PALS are open Monday to Friday 9am to 4pm, except bank holidays. If you phone and get the voicemail please leave a message and the team will get back to you.

Thank you for your feedback in relation to your online line triage experience.  I will ensure this is shared with all our primary care health care professionals, kindest Regards Mrs Sharon Snape Practice Manager
We appreciate feedback and look to continuously improve our service to our patients to aim for excellence.
We appreciate feedback and look to continuously improve our service to our patients to aim for excellence.

Thank you very much for taking the time to tell us about your positive experience at the surgery. Our staff work hard to provide the best possible service for our patients and it is very reassuring to hear when we have done something well.  
With best wishes
Liz Pope, Practice Manager

Dear Patient
Thank you for taking the time to write a review and it is great to hear your consultation went well.   All feedback is shared and discussed with the team. 
Happy new year.
Katy Hutchinson - Practice Manager

Dear Patient
Thank you for taking the time to write a review.   It is lovely to hear your daughters' asthma check went well.  All feedback is shared and discussed with the team. 
Happy New Year
Katy Hutchinson - Practice Manager

Dear Pippa & Colin
Thank you for taking the time to write a review.   Your feedback for our Practice Nurse is greatly appreciated and will be shared and discussed with the team.  All feedback helps with the surgery's learning and improving.   
Happy New Year
Katy Hutchinson - Practice Manager

Dear Mr Zarych
Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review.   I am sorry for your delayed appointment, we do release appointments every day at 8am and also offer pre-bookable appointments which may be what you had received.   It is lovely to hear your kind feedback for the Dr, this will be shared and discussed with the team.   
Happy New Year
Katy Hutchinson - Practice Manager

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the Practice.  I am pleased you found our services helpful and will share your comments with our wider team.

Catherine Smith, Business Manager
Thank you for your kind comments. Our old telephone system was only four years old but was as frustrating for us as it was our patients which is why we replaced it. Thank you for bearing with us.

Dear Patient
Thank you for taking the time to write a review.
All feedback is greatly appreciated and we are very pleased to read your consultation went well. 
Your review will be shared and discussed with the team, all feedback helps us to learn and improve. 
Happy New Year
Katy Hutchinson - Practice Manager

Dear Anita
Thank you for taking the time to write this review. 
Your review regarding smear tests is greatly appreciated and will help put others at ease when reading this.   All feedback will be shared and discussed with the team. 
Happy New Year
Katy Hutchinson - Practice Manager

Thank you for taking the time to feedback regarding our services. 
We appreciate your positive comments and these have been shared with the wider Practice team.

Catherine Smith, Business Manager

Dear Anonymous

Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience of Salford Royal. Its great to hear that you have no complaints about our service. I do however apologise for your cancelled appointment, if you are still waiting to hear about your next appointment and would like us to investigate this further for you, please contact our Patient Advice and Liasion Service on 0161 778 5665 or pals@nca.nhs.uk

Kind regards
The Patient Experience Team

Dear Mr Hancock,

Thank you for your feedback, I have passed this on to our team and we are grateful for your kind words. The service is seeing an unprecedented demand through the winter months but our patients' care and safety remains our upmost priority.

Kind regards,
Cranleigh Medical Practice

Dear Susan

Thank you for taking the time to leave your review of our services. Its great to hear that our staff provided you with wonderful care from admission to discharge and that all of our staff you came into contact with did an amazing job. I will make sure to pass your details on to the team.

Kind regards
The Patient Experience Team

It is very kind of you to leave positive feedback which will be shared with the whole team. We are pleased that we were able to help in a timely manner.  
Tadley Medical Partnership

body:
Thank you for your wonderful review! We're delighted to hear you are happy with your Hearing Aids. We’ll pass your comments on to your local branch, and we look forward to assisting
you again in future.

Thank you for your comments. We always endeavour to try and be as helpful and supportive as we can for our patients, even though we are under a lot of pressure in the NHS. Your kind comments have been passed on to our reception team and the doctor. We do appreciate you taking the time to review us.

Dear Patient 
thank you for your feedback.  I am sorry you feel there has been a recording error.  Please feel free to contact the practice and report the complaint so we can investigate your specific case further 
thanks 
Sukhi Ghattaora 
Practice Manager

Dear patient,
Thank you for your positive feedback regarding care you received at our practice.  I appreciate you taking the time to confirm that the process we use to triage and arranging face to face appointments was a pleasant experience for you.  As your Patient Relations Manager I will ensure that your feedback is shared with the team.  Kind regards, J.Clarke - Patient Relations Manager

Dear Patient 
I would like to thank you for your feedback regarding obtaining an appointment.  I appreciate your frustration regarding these concerns and as your Patient Relations Manager would like to invite you to contact me so that we can discuss these further.  Please email me at -  complaints@thebrookmedicalcentre.com
Kind Regards J.Clarke - Patient Relations Manager
Thank you for your feedback and bringing this to our attention as patient safety remains a priority. We will contact you directly to discuss this to ensure a satisfactory outcome.

Dear Patient...

Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback following your recent contact with the practice.

I was really pleased to hear that you felt supported by the practice and our teams and will share your feedback with the practice.

Thanks again

Simon

Simon Stitson
Practice Business Manager#
Grove Medical Practice

Dear Sandra
Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of our surgery.
Your comments are greatly appreciated and have been shared with all of the surgery team.
Thank you for acknowledging the role of our reception staff, with the increase in different Health Care Professionals joining General Practice they are best placed to direct our patients to the correct clinician to see them.
Thank you again
Julie Murphy - Practice Manager

Dear Austen…

Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback following your recent contact with the practice.  I was pleased to hear that you felt supported by our team and that our call back system worked well for you.  

As you mentioned, the NHS remains under considerable pressure at the moment and teams across the NHS are working hard to support patients.  Thank you for your understanding and for your support and for sharing your experience.  I have shared your thank you with our Team.


Thanks again

Simon 

Simon Stitson
Practice Business Manager
Grove Medical Practice

Dear Patient,
Thank you for this feedback and for taking the time to discuss this with me in person during December. I am sorry that you are not happy with the service that you have received. As Practice Manager I do look at all feedback and adjust our services as much as we can to meet demand for example we have a new phone system and have made some changes to our appointment systems, including having appointments with many different clinicians 7am - 8pm and at weekends. We are in a time of unprecedented demand across  General Practice and the wider NHS. If you wish to contact me further please contact the practice and ask for the Practice Manager and I will be happy to help and listen to your suggestions on how else we can try to meet demand.

signature: Head of Patient Voice and Involvement, Clinical Quality and Patient Safety, East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust
body: I'm sorry to hear about your son's recent experience at William Harvey Hospital Emergency Department (ED). If you would like us to look into what happened, including whether the delays were due to the volume of patients and how seriously unwell other patients waiting were, and whether your son was appropriately triaged, please contact our Patient Advice and Liaison Service (PALS) on tel: 01227 783145 or email: ekh-tr.pals@nhs.net. PALS are open Monday to Friday 9am to 4pm, except bank holidays. If you phone and get the voicemail please leave a message and the team will get back to you.

The Patient Experience Team

body:
Thank you for your review, we are saddened to hear that this was your experience of our hospitals. At NUH we operate a strict No Smoking policy in order to keep our staff and patients healthy. I’m so sorry that you experienced this on your visit and I have informed security whom I am sure will do their best to enforce this wherever possible. 
Estates and facilities manager - Nottingham university hospitals.

On behalf of The Cambridge Practice,
 
We are sorry you had such an unpleasant experience and encounter with our service.
We continuously strive to ensure that we deliver an effective service that is responsive and caring towards our patients in a safe and well led manner. Your feedback is important to us. It helps us improve the way we deliver our care. If you would like us to look into your concern in more detail please contact us directly via email at thecambridge.practice@nhs.net, FAO: Practice Business Managing Partner. We will try to help resolve your issue.

We always have at least 2 Nurses on site.  If you could confirm the date of the appointment and the name of your daughter we can investigate this fully.  Practice Manager - Woodside Medical Centre

Shingles is a live vaccine, needing to be reconstituted, rather than being in a pre-filled syringe. Patients need to be carefully checked for any contraindications and fully advised about side effects before administration. We are sorry but it is not safe to "squeeze" this into a five minute blood test appointment. We do, whenever possible, try to ensure that patient care is given in as few visits as possible, both for the efficiency of the practice and the convenience of the patient. This is reliant on sufficient time being allocated to undertake procedures safely. If your blood test could wait until the longer appointment on 12th January then it would be possible to do these two together. Please contact us if this would be helpful.

Dear patient,
Thank you very much for taking the time to provide feedback. We do find this valuable in providing a positive experience for all patients.
Kind regards,
Ainsdale Medical Centre

Dear Phumzile, we are sorry to hear you had a bad experience. Our receptionists do not know what medications are for and only advise that prescriptions would be ready within 48 hours unless you were contacted which you were. We have looked into this for you and the medication that you requested can only be prescribed by a hospital. Our pharmacist tried to call you on the same day but you didn't answer so she sent you a text to inform you of this and to call us back if you wanted to discuss it. You called back 3 days later and spoke to one of our GPs who informed you of the same thing. We are sorry that you felt mismanaged but there are some services that we cannot provide.

We are sorry for your recent experience with the dental hospital and would be very interested in exploring this further with you. If you would like to discuss this please contact our Patient Relations Department on 0191 2231382 or e-mail nuth.patient.relations@nhs.net. 

If you wish to raise your concerns with someone who is not involved in your care, the Patient Advice and Liaison Service (PALS) can listen to your issues and aim to help sort out problems quickly and can be contacted on Freephone 0800 032 02 02 or by email on northoftynepals@nhct.nhs.uk.

Hello Mr Cater

If you would like to contact us at hnyicb-ny.haxbypatientexperience@nhs.net with your concerns we will be happy to look into this for you.

Kind regards

Karen Walton
Patient Experience Administrator

signature: Patient Experience Administrator, Patient Experience, The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust
body:
Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at our hospital and rate our services as 5 star.  
It is great to hear that you received excellent care and treatment in Ward B1 and B2. We are thrilled to hear that staff were able to put you at ease during what must have been a difficult time for you.  
Your kind comments have been shared with the team and senior management who will be pleased to hear of them.  
All the best and take care.  
Patient Experience Team
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

body:
Dear Patient, thank you for your review. I am sorry you feel like you have not been able to get an appointment so I will use this opportunity to explain the best ways to get one. We are actually one of the practices that offers quite a lot of appointments but you will have seen that nationally the NHS is under a lot pressure.
Appointments can be booked everyday from 8am. They can be booked either by online directly using the NHS app, by telephone, or by attending one of the surgery sites to book in person. You can also send us an Econsult, which will allow us to assess your problem and offer you an appointment directly. We usually respond to Econsults within one to two working days. Econsults are really good as they provide you with a lot of advice that might even resolve your problem without seeing a doctor.
Prescriptions can be requested also through the NHS app or by calling our medication line on 01322628290. This line is open Monday to Friday 8.30-1pm.
If you call the GP for help and you are advised to attend A+E, this is likely because we are concerned you need more urgent help than we can provide.
We have recently recruited more reception staff to help with answering the phones so hopefully, that should improve shortly.
We hope this explains things in such a way that will enable you to access our services with greater ease.
Thank you once again for your review.
Dr Wole Olarinmoye, GP Principal

Dear Joseph,
Thank you for taking the time to send us your positive feedback. We have shared your comments with our team, which are always valuable.
Kind regards from the Communications Team

body:
Dear Mark,
Thank you for taking the time to send us your feedback following your treatment. It is great to hear and we have passed your comments on to the teams.
Kind regards from the Communications Team.

Dear Gerry,
thank you very much for sharing your feedback about the Cardiac Rehab Unit team. It is always valuable to receive patient feedback. We have passed on your comments and praise to the team. 
Kind regards from the Communications Team

Dear Barbara,
Thank you for your wonderful comment. We are so glad that you got the help that you needed from the member of staff you spoke to. Your response is very much appreciated.

Kind regards

Sheree Welch
Patient & Public Involvement Officer

Dear Patient,    You have left this comment anonymously so I am unable to contact you, but if you would like to ring me I would like to ask a few questions so I can investigate further.  My team have had a call and booked a patient that was referred by 111, and 111 can see our appointments,  but if this is NOT you I would like to speak to you regarding the emergency, as we have pathways to follow to book patients appropriately. 0116 2957100   Vicky Hill, Practice Manager.

It is taking longer to reply to comments, as we have been very busy, but this one was from March 21!.   Thank you for your kind comments and we hope you have stayed fit and well since your vaccines.   
Thank you again.   Vicky Hill, Practice Manager
Thank you for taking time to log in and leave comments.   This supports the team in working through this very busy period.

Dear Patient, 

Thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback. 

We are sorry that you are unsatisfied with our appointment booking system. All of our Practice Receptionists have been instructed and trained on our appointment protocol and due to demand we are currently were operating a same day appointment system. All patients requesting an appointment are advised to either call or visit the surgery Monday to Friday from 8am. 

We understand this is not suitable for all of our patients, therefore we also offer same day access via our surgery app Dr. iQ, which is open from 7am Monday to Friday.

We are able to schedule routine appointments in advance for follow ups or to discuss results; however, there may be a short wait for these appointments.

Patients who do not wish to wait are advised to contact the surgery from 8am, Monday to Friday to arrange a telephone appointment on the day, or alternatively to complete an online consultation via our surgery app Dr. iQ.

We are currently in the process of offering more pre-bookable appointments that can be either face-to-face or telephone appointments based on the patient’s preference. We are reviewing this regularly ensuring our appointment process meets the needs of our patients.

If you would like to discuss this further please contact our Assistant Practice Manager at the surgery, Michaela O'Reilly or Practice Manager Justyna Lisiecka on 0207 407 4101.

Kind Regards, 

Michaela O'Reilly
Assistant Practice Manager
